intro: Mikania yanacochensis, commonly known as the Andean Mikania, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Mikania yanacochensis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
